feesRequired.title: When Are These Fees Required?
feesRequired.subtitle: Foreign investment fees are required in specific circumstances when purchasing Australian residential property:

required.title: FIRB Fees Required
items: Foreign citizens purchasing any Australian residential property
Temporary residents buying established dwellings or vacant land
Non-residents making any residential property investment
Companies/trusts with foreign ownership purchasing residential property

notRequired.title: Fees NOT required if you are:
items: An Australian citizen or permanent resident
A New Zealand citizen with Special Category Visa (subclass 444)
A temporary resident buying a new dwelling to live in

firbApproval.title: When is FIRB Approval Required?
firbApproval.subtitle: Understanding the Foreign Investment Review Board (FIRB) approval process and requirements

whatIs.title: What is FIRB?
whatIs.content: The Foreign Investment Review Board (FIRB) is an Australian government body that reviews foreign investment proposals. Under the Foreign Acquisitions and Takeovers Act 1975, foreign persons must obtain FIRB approval before purchasing residential property in Australia.

timeline.title: Processing Timeline
timeline.standard: Standard applications take 30 days from receipt of complete application
timeline.expedited: Expedited processing available for additional fee (10 days)

steps.title: Apply Online
steps.description: Submit your application through the FIRB portal with property details and supporting documents

steps.title: Pay Application Fee
steps.description: Application fees range from $13,200 to $100,000+ based on property value

steps.title: Wait for Decision
steps.description: Standard processing takes 30 days. You'll receive a 'no objection' notification if approved

steps.title: Settle Property
steps.description: Complete your purchase within 12 months of approval and comply with all conditions

requirements.title: Key Requirements
items: Complete documentation including passport, visa, and property details
Compliance with approval conditions (e.g., primary residence for temporary residents)

penalties.title: Important: Penalties for Non-Compliance
penalties.warning: Purchasing without FIRB approval when required is a serious offence with severe penalties:
items: Fines up to $3.3 million for individuals
Criminal prosecution with up to 10 years imprisonment
Loss of capital gains and future approval difficulties
